sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Introduction review:

mi'e = ?
do cmene ma = ?
pendo = ?

(Answers: I'm [name], What's your name?, friend)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
mamta x1 is a mother of x2 mother
patfu x1 is a father of x2 father
panzi x1 is a child/offspring of x2 child/offspring

Describing Family

la .mari. cu mamta mi

Mary is my mother.

la .djak. cu patfu mi

Jack is my father.

mi panzi la .mari.

I am a child of Mary.

Questions About Family

do se mamta ma

Who is your mother?

do se bruna xu

Do you have a brother? (Are you brothered?)

do panzi xokau

How many children do you have?

Family Dialogue

A: xu do se bruna
B: .ie .i mi se bruna la .tam.
A: xu do se mensi
B: na go'i .i mi na se mensi

(A: Do you have a brother? B: Yes, I have a brother Tom. A: Do you have a sister? B: No, I don't have a sister.)

Key Point

Family terms use place structure: x1 is [relation] of x2. Use se to ask "do you have a [relation]?"
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: State Relationships

Translate:

  1. Mary is my mother.
  2. Jack is my father.
  3. Alice is my child.
Answers
  1. la .mari. cu mamta mi
  2. la .djak. cu patfu mi
  3. la .alis. cu panzi mi

Exercise 2: Ask About Family

Translate:

  1. Who is your father?
  2. Do you have a sister?
  3. How many brothers do you have?
Answers
  1. do se patfu ma
  2. xu do se mensi
  3. do se bruna xokau

Exercise 3: Create Family Dialogue

Write a dialogue about your family:

Example Answer 
A: do se mamta ma
B: la .mari. cu mamta mi
A: xu do se bruna
B: .ie .i la .tam. cu bruna mi
A: xu la .tam. cu barda
B: na go'i .i ri cmalu

items.text: How many brothers do you have?

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Describe your family aloud:

Use at least 3 family terms.

Example:

la .mari. cu mamta mi
.i la .djak. cu patfu mi
.i mi se bruna la .tam.
.i mi na se mensi

Summary

You practiced describing family relationships and asking about others' families.
